benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios validate creation with required and optional headers (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC23).
POST - Invalid Payload: Missing required fields, empty body, malformed JSON, invalid currency, and security payloads (XSS/SQLi) return 400 (TC04, TC08, TC09, TC05, TC18).
POST - Duplicate Submission: Existing planId conflict handled with 400 (TC06).
POST - Large Payloads: Very large payload behavior considered (TC15).
POST - Validation: Boundary tests for max lengths and minimum numeric values included (TC12, TC13).
Resiliency/Recovery: Retry after transient network failure results in success (TC16).
Method Handling: 405 for unsupported HTTP method (TC14).
Dependency/Service Availability: 503 when catalog service is down and degraded dependency handling (TC11, TC24).
Post-condition verification: New plan retrievable/propagated to dependent services (TC01, TC23).
Concurrency: Parallel valid requests succeed without conflicts (TC22).
gaps: POST - Server Error Handling: No simulation of internal errors (e.g., DB failure) returning 500.
Content Negotiation: No checks for Content-Type requirements or 415 Unsupported Media Type when sending non-JSON, nor response Content-Type assertions.
Response Headers: No validation of Location header or other creation-related headers on 201; only checks body contains a string/URI.
Idempotency on Retry: Network retry scenario does not assert that only one plan is created (no duplicate resource check).

Validation Depth: Missing tests for invalid data types, negative/zero amount when not allowed, precision/scale for amount, invalid enum values (billingPeriod, productCategory), and cross-field constraints.
Authorization/Permissions: No 403 scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user/role.
Conflict Semantics: Only planId conflict is tested; no conflicts on productName/productCategory combinations or catalog-version constraints.
Header Validation: No tests for invalid/oversized X-Killbill-* header values or missing optional headers with default behavior.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No 429 behavior under burst POSTs beyond TC22 happy-path concurrency.
Timeouts/Latency: Response time SLA is tested (TC17) but no client/server timeout error handling (e.g., 504 Gateway Timeout) or retry/backoff guidance.
Schema Strictness: Extra fields accepted with 201 (TC07) but there is no explicit test ensuring unknown fields are ignored vs. cause validation error per schema expectations.
recommendations: Add server fault-injection tests to assert 500 Internal Server Error handling and error response schema.
Add content negotiation tests: reject non-JSON with 415; assert request with Content-Type: application/json; verify response Content-Type and optionally Location header on 201.
Enhance idempotency coverage: simulate duplicate POST retries with same payload/request-id and assert exactly one plan exists; verify no double-creation.
Expand validation matrix: invalid data types, negative/zero and high-precision amounts, invalid enums for billingPeriod/productCategory, currency precision rules, and combined field constraints.
Add authorization test for 403 Forbidden when authenticated user lacks permissions.
Broaden conflict scenarios beyond planId (e.g., productName/productCategory uniqueness rules if applicable) and catalog-version constraints.
Validate header value constraints: very long/invalid X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment and Unicode handling.
Introduce rate limiting test to validate 429 Too Many Requests under sustained bursts and proper Retry-After headers.
Add timeout/error-path tests: simulate upstream timeouts leading to 504 and verify retry/backoff behavior.
Clarify schema handling for unknown fields: add tests to assert whether extra fields are ignored or rejected per API contract and document expected behavior.
